result.execSummary:
The defendant Tara J. Olds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant must obtain her GED.

The defendant may not possess/consume any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter into any bars/taverns.

The defendant may not have any contact with: RD - dob 5/9/02, GD - dob 1/23/07 and DP - dob 1/26/06.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber granted - eligible for community service under 973.03(3).

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tara J. Olds in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:39 PM. State - resolved - joint recommendation of DRI counts #1 and #2, count 3 amended to 948.40(4) - class A misd, plead NC/G to count #4 as alleged and to count #3 as amended, withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years on counts #3 and #4 - concurrent to each other, with 90 days jail on count #3, other conditions of probation are: costs on each count, AODA, maintain absolute sobriety, employment/school, 125 hours of community service, no contact with any victim/child used in the crime. Olds and Finlan agree - some discussion regarding inpatient treatment as part of her jail time. Court dismisses and reads in counts #1 and #2, court amends count #3 to contributing to the delinquency of a child contrary to 948.40(4). Olds pleads NC to counts #3 and #4. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - would like a condition of no contact with RD - DOB 5/9/02, GD - DOB 1/23/07 or DP - DOB 1/26/06 - won't object to Finlan's argument of inpatient treatment as part of jail sentence (day for day - up to 45 days). Finlan makes final argument - follow joint recommendation - argues for inpatient treatment as part of jail sentence (day for day - up to 45 days). Olds makes statement, asks for inpatient treatment credit. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #3 and #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: count #3 - 90 days in FC jail - report today - huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.013(3) - no credit for time spent in inpatient treatment but would consider a furlough if a bed is available, costs on each count - paid thru probation, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, AODA and follow thru, 125 hours of community service, maintain/obtain full time employment/school with verbage, no contact with RD - DOB 5/9/02, GD - DOB 1/23/07 or DP - DOB 1/26/06, obtain GED, provide DNA sample, right to appeal. Finlan asks that 30 days that the defendant is to serve on a child support warrant to run concurrent to the jail ordered in this matter (11FA22). State has no opionion on that request - leaves to Court's discretion. Court - discusses matter - reviews 11FA22 - vacates committment order at this point and CSA can set for another hearing (not sure if the defendant was noticed for that hearing).

Defendant Tara J. Olds in court with attorney Patrick Howard Finlan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:49 PM. Finlan provides court with waiver of preliminary hearing. Olds agrees. Court goes over form with defendant and finds the defendant is freely and voluntarily waiving her right to a PH, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State has filed INFO (mirrors). Finlan has INFO, waives further reading. Proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas. Bond will be continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
RD - subservice on his mother RP
GD - sub service on his mother RP

Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Burns appears for Patrick Finlan. Defendant Tara J. Olds in court. Called at 9:12 AM. Court reads charges and penalties. Olds and Burns understand charges and penalties. Burns waives further reading, requests PH. State - bond - $2000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol and no contact with the victim or her residence  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
